DataElement.preferredName: Patient Current And Revised Response Assessment Criteria Agreement Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether there was agreement or concordance between current and revised disease response criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Current And Revised Response Assessment Criteria Agreement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the agreement (the act of agreeing) between current (occurring in the present time) and revised (altered or modified) response assessment (determining the extent of pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment) criteria (reference points against which other things can be evaluated).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Current And Revision Response Assessment Criterion Agreement
Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:The act of or altering (involving reconsideration and modification).:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may refer to eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.:Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.:Criteria; a basis for comparison; a reference point against which other things can be evaluated.:1. The act of agreeing. 2. Harmony of opinion; accord. (from American Heritage Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
An act of alteration involving reconsideration and modification.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.
The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Was concordance in response a
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was concordance in response achieved between INRC and revised INRC components

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the overall response per 1993 INRC criteria the same as the overall response per recently revised INRC criteria?
